subject: Re: [junit] How to test exceptions in java with junit
msgSnippet: ... Sure.  Redundancy doesn t hurt, but ideally, you could use the comment to explain why it s safe to ignore this particular exception.  Swallowing exceptions
messageBody:
On 2/24/06, James Abley <james.abley@...> wrote:
>
> Cédric,
>
> Doesn't the fact that you name the Exception parameter ignore (or
> expected,
> or ...) communicate this intent? Is it a checkstyle thing that forces you
> to
> put the comment in as well?


Sure. Redundancy doesn't hurt, but ideally, you could use the comment to
explain why it's safe to ignore this particular exception. Swallowing
exceptions can lead to very painful debugging sessions, so it's worth taking
some time to explain why your reviewer shouldn't worry.

--
Cédric


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
